image.longCaption: A view of the SuperSport Park from the stands, South Africa v New Zealand, 2nd Test, Centurion, 2nd day, November 17, 2007

match.hoursInfo: 13.30 start, First Session 13.30-17.00, Interval 17.00-17.45, Second Session 17.45-21.15

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers lbw b Yadav 109 (101b 6x4 5x6 133m) SR: 107.92

dismissalComment.html: some relief for India here, AB shuffles a long way across his stumps to flick it away, Yadav bowls it fuller and the ball clips the pads, you could see the leg stump so a fairly easy decision for the umpire

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock b I Sharma 101 (120b 9x4 2x6 149m) SR: 84.16

dismissalComment.html: makes room to swing and he misses! Ishant bowls an off cutter on the stumps, de Kock exposes all three and swings, the ball clips the top of the leg stump, the stumps are erect and the bails go flying

headshotImage.caption: Henry Davids player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Henry Davids player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: And Ishant has struck! Davids fails to make use of this opportunity, he comes forward to a length ball outside off, looks to defend but gets an outside edge to second slip, Raina does well to move to his left and take it on the fall

two for the over and Ishant really does look a different bowler here! Duminy was squared up the previous ball and this time he was on the back foot to defend, didn't cover the line properly at all and the ball moved away and took the outside edge to second slip, Raina in business again and he times his dive forward well, takes it inches off the turf

makes room to swing and he misses! Ishant bowls an off cutter on the stumps, de Kock exposes all three and swings, the ball clips the top of the leg stump, the stumps are erect and the bails go flying

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: picks deep midwicket and Ishant takes his 100th ODI wicket! Slower ball and McLaren makes room and swings, Yadav runs forward and takes it well in front of the rope

Caught at short square leg but they're checking for a no-ball for height! And Amla has to go. It was a full toss close to the waist, Amla looked to flick it away and he found Yuvraj who cupped it easily, the side angle showed the ball to be within the limit so it was a legal delivery
the short one gets Parnell! Rising towards the face and he takes evasive action and yet goes ahead with the pull, miscues it and Rohit takes it easily at deep square leg
chopped it onto his stumps, Shami bowls it short, Philander makes room to swing, inside edge lands on top of the middle stump, stumps are upright and the bails go for a toss

dismissalText.long: c Yuvraj Singh b Mohammed Shami
dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Yuvraj Singh b Mohammed Shami 13 (16b 3x4 0x6 21m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: Caught at short square leg but they're checking for a no-ball for height! And Amla has to go. It was a full toss close to the waist, Amla looked to flick it away and he found Yuvraj who cupped it easily, the side angle showed the ball to be within the limit so it was a legal delivery

dismissalText.commentary: Wayne Parnell c RG Sharma b Mohammed Shami 9 (8b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 112.5

dismissalComment.html: the short one gets Parnell! Rising towards the face and he takes evasive action and yet goes ahead with the pull, miscues it and Rohit takes it easily at deep square leg

dismissalText.commentary: Vernon Philander b Mohammed Shami 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: chopped it onto his stumps, Shami bowls it short, Philander makes room to swing, inside edge lands on top of the middle stump, stumps are upright and the bails go for a toss

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

commentTextItems.html: round the wicket and Miller makes room and drills it down to long-off and they take 2, SA have passed 300

commentPostTextItems.html: 5pm: Familiar story for India as they concede yet another 300-plus score. India failed to drive the advantage after having SA at an unfamiliar 28 for 3 in 8 overs. De Kock and AB scored centuries and now the Indian batsmen once again will have to try and clean up the mess. They haven't been able to do so so far. Ishant was the surprise package with a four-wicket haul.
The comforting thought for India is that Steyn and Morkel are not playing so this is their best chance yet. Join us at 5.45 for the chase.

And here's a dubious stat the Indian bowlers should not read. This is the tenth instance of conceding a score of 300 or more in ODIs in a calendar year, a world record. They eclipsed their own record of 9 in 2009.
Mark Kidger: "Given the rate at which South Africa were scoring in mid-innings, 301 is a disappointing total. India know that they could have been facing 350."

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: that was well played, short ball expectedly, Tsotsobe rode the bounce and spooned it over the keeper, Ishant was fine at third man

dismissalText.commentary: Vernon Philander b Mohammed Shami 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: chopped it onto his stumps, Shami bowls it short, Philander makes room to swing, inside edge lands on top of the middle stump, stumps are upright and the bails go for a toss
full on the pads and flicked away to deep square leg

commentPreTextItems.html: Can SA get 300?

commentTextItems.html: at first it looked like he miscued it but it traveled alright! Makes room to a length ball and swings over deep midwicket, went up miles in the air and still had enough to clear the rope, a welcome fifty for Miller

dismissalText.long: c RG Sharma b Mohammed Shami
dismissalText.commentary: Wayne Parnell c RG Sharma b Mohammed Shami 9 (8b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 112.5

commentTextItems.html: the short one gets Parnell! Rising towards the face and he takes evasive action and yet goes ahead with the pull, miscues it and Rohit takes it easily at deep square leg
another low full toss put away! Wide outside off, Miller takes him down town, through the line and a flat six over wide long-off
full outside off and driven down to sweeper cover
fires that full outside off and Miller slams it along the turf to deep cover and Ishant does well to slide and cut it off, could easily have over-run it
good over so far, keeps it full and close to the yorker length, can only jam it out for no runs
drifts on the pads and he flicks it away in the air down to long-on
stays back and flicks it away straight to midwicket
punishes a low full toss! Not such a great over for India, gives him width and the field is up on the off side, sped away past cover
full outside off and he drives to mid-off
breaks the shackles with a boundary, he errs by dropping short, Parnell pulls wide of midwicket, Kohli gives it his best running from long-on but dives in vain
well bowled, fired that full on the pads and he flicked it to midwicket, India pulling things back
gets away with another one on the pads as he works it straight to Ishant at short fine leg
fires that full on the pads and he flicks it to deep midwicket
ends the over with a yorker, well bowled Ishant, he manages to dig it out
short of a length and he tucks it to midwicket

commentPreTextItems.html: The presentation is on.

Dhoni: "We were looking positive at the break. This was one of the best pitches for the batsmen. We exposed their middle order to some extent and we were able to capitalise with the new ball. Playing the ODIs before the tests is good to get used to the pace and bounce. If tall bowlers bowl the right lengths you can get wickets (Ishant). He worked hard with the bowling coach and played a few domestic games. He bowled brilliantly today. South Africa are blessed that they have so many seam bowling allrouders."

Quinton de Kock is the Man of the Series: "Just got to keep working hard to get a couple more (tons). I'm quite relaxed and happy on the inside. More happy that we won the series. I switched to another mode to try and survive and push on later. I'm not sure how this series will impact my career."

Strangely, they cut to the studio without showing AB's interview. I'm assuming there was one. Had to be one, surely. I'm sure you will read about what AB has to say about his team's series win in due course. Look out for our post-match stuff from Sidharth Monga and Firdose.
Thanks for your company. I'm sure it was frustrating for many after the innings break. Will the Test series be just as one-sided? Join us for that starting December 18 at the Wanderers. Cheers!
8.10pm: The match is called off. Just the one innings today. South Africa take the series 2-0.

We should have resumed at 5.45pm, but thanks to the (mostly) persistent rain over the last two and a half hours, the umpires decided enough is enough. Quinton de Kock made his third consecutive century and AB de Villiers joined him in taking SA to 300, a score that looked unlikely after they were 28 for 3. The records will count, despite the washout.
We're expecting a presentation to round off the series. I think we already know who the Man of the Series will be. Do stay on with us for a bit.

Jerome: "Indian Cricket Team(under Dhoni's captaincy) is like that kid who sings all poems by heart in front of his parents, but goes mute when asked to sing while visiting a relatives house!!.. We miss Dada :-("

karthik: "@Karandeep : It no denial that dhoni is a good captain, but the results does not tally to your comparison to pointing and ganguly. I am not saying this because of the loss to SA.Give me one series where in the team has performed outside india like the kapil devils or like the dada's gang .."
8pm: If we are to get any play, the rain needs to stop in the next 10-15 minutes.

Karandeep Nagpal: "@ Karthik- It was Kapil Dev who made the team believe that they can win. Ganguly added that X-factor of aggression. Dhoni is a composed man. A blend of Ponting (in a way that he stands for the team) , Ganguly (aggression when needed), Steve Waugh (The desire to win) and most importantly MSD when it comes to listening to instincts."
7.50pm: We should have had an inspection now but the rain's gotten heavier. The situation looks bleak, if it wasn't bad enough already.

Achilles: "Regarding Ishanth, pls dont go overboard with just one performance as it doesnt mask the numerous bad times he has had over the year. It is simple, for Ishant to gain form he needs to get his speed back, bowling in 130s would never help. Just look at Shami and what that extra pace has done to him. Ishant bowling in the high 140s would be a big bonus in Australia come 2015.."

karthik: "Situations like these remains us of Ganguly, the captain who taught us how to win abroad.I always wonder why Ganguly is so highly rated and the answer is so obvious now.The fighting spirit of the Indian team that was so evident in the dada era is absent now..." It's hard to forget 8-0.

Arvind Awasthi: "@al warming, I just think it has to do with the length Ishant bowls. He is good length kind of bowler and good length works well overseas. But in subcontinent that is a dangerous line to bowl as batsman hit you on the rise. I think he needs to be smarter when he bowls in sub-continent with his length and variation especially in death."
bhai: "By etymology I can say de Kock will score two more centuries - Quint Ton." His next ODI opposition is Zimbabwe, but that's a long while away.
7.40pm: And it has started drizzling again! This might change the inspection plans. The covers are back on.

Manu: "When Ishant was dropped from the Indian team, he went back to domestic cricket and picked up 9 wickets in a match for Delhi. Maybe he worked on something over the break, which is helping now. He seems fired up and determined. Let's hope he can carry that form into the test series. A good test series can do a world of good for his confidence and his future."

al warming: "Questions on Ishant Sharma: Why is he so different outside India ? Or, rather why is he so lackluster in India ? Just the bounce of the pitch doesn't seem to justify the difference in performances within 2 months."
7.25pm: There will be an inspection at 7.50pm. The latest the game can start is 8.55pm.
Even of the game is abandoned, the records will still count. Therefore de Kock's and AB's centuries will not be erased... as well as Ishant's 4 for 40.
7.15pm: Now it has stopped. The 5-minute updates continue. The covers are now coming off.
Karandeep Nagpal: "It had to rain today seeing how Ishant Sharma performed today! :D" The Ishant-jibes continue. No letting up. Poor chap
Srinivas Goud: "Actually, this stop, start, stop, start rain sequence has more drama and unpredictability than the boring collapse of Indian batting!"
7.10pm: .... and it has started drizzling again! Put that rain jacket back in the cupboard.
Bongwe: "It's raining again in Tembisa which is around 20 km's south of Centurion. So the rain is still coming."

Suresh Babu: "I see the issue of india's non performance as lack of proper planning, Can't they send few players to SA in advance, I mean they come 3 days before their 1st game and expect to chase down 350 plus after playing months on flat wickets, Its absolutely ridiculous to expect, Pakistan did surprise though." There was an A tour some months back but the pitches were as flat as snooker tables, or so we heard. Ideal practice? Maybe not.
7.05pm: The covers are coming off the pitch and there will be an inspection in the next ten minutes. Further rain will change all that, of course.
Anuj: "Should I bother staying up and hope for the rain to relent to see another batting collapse or go to bed now?" Know anyone at the clouds?
7.00pm: I can assure you we are not fooling around with you. It has stopped now....until the next update. The groundsmen are at work, drying the covers.
6.55pm: It has started raining again! You saw that coming, didn't you?
Mohandas Menon tweets the revised targets, should it come down to any of these: 167 in 20 ov, 197 in 25 ov, 223 in 30 ov, 247 in 35 ov, 267 in 40 ov, 286 in 45 ov

Danny: "Don't blame young batsmen for the failure, First to be blamed is selectors, Zaheer and Pujara should have been in ODI squad. Second is lack of preparation by Team India Bowling in the form of studying the opposition players, conditions and grounds. We need to have specific strategy for specific batsmen. Pakistan was in SA few days ago and they won the series against hosts purely by bowling well."
6.45pm: The rain has stopped again, but plenty of water still on the covers. Looks okay in the distance.
Abhishek: "Come on guys!! don't be so harsh on these young guys... we were thrashed in SA even when we had the Tendulkar's the Dravid's..... Let give some time to these young guns..."
SID: "So is it gonna be 22 runs in 1 ball according to DWL?? would be irony then wouldn't it?"
6.35pm: They turned the tap on again. Rain has resumed but it's not as cloudy as it was before. If it stops raining by 7:15, the umpires will make an inspection.
6.20pm: Better news now. It has stopped raining. This ground drains well and according to Sidharth Monga, we could be back in 40 minutes.
Leehar: "It's back to raining heavily in Jo'burg, so even if it's cleared up for a bit in Centurion, I wouldn't be optimistic for an uninterrupted match! Lets keep those DWL calculators handy!"
6.10pm: Still raining at Centurion. There's still the one-hour window before they start reducing overs (6.45pm). It's getting heavier and heavier and some spectators are making their way out already.
There is of course another live match in progress, in Dubai. You may catch up on that in the meantime.
jay: "Watching atrocious Indian performance, even the heavens have closed their ranks and want no part of this farce."
5.50pm: The tap's on in full force. It's pouring down at Centurion.
cris: "Looks like even the Gods are tired of watching India's feeble performances this week. Crossing my fingers for a thunderstorm at the WACA on Friday:)"

Vinoj: "The top SA batsmen, H Amla, de Kock and AB have scored 709 in the three matches. If India wins this match, scoring 302, then all Indian batsmen in all the three games will have scored only 665....still those three ahead"

5.45pm: Update from the ground is that it has indeed started raining. The covers were on early as precaution. The chase should have started by now. I guess those at the ground can head back to the snack counter or bar for another drink, or five.
But the reassuring thing about Centurion is the drainage. Re-plugging Monga's diary on that here.
5.35pm: Welcome back. Just saw a tweet saying that the covers are on in Centurion. It looks like we will certainly have a delay. Will let you know once I get more details.

dismissalText.long: c Yuvraj Singh b Mohammed Shami
dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla c Yuvraj Singh b Mohammed Shami 13 (16b 3x4 0x6 21m) SR: 81.25

dismissalComment.html: Caught at short square leg but they're checking for a no-ball for height! And Amla has to go. It was a full toss close to the waist, Amla looked to flick it away and he found Yuvraj who cupped it easily, the side angle showed the ball to be within the limit so it was a legal delivery

dismissalText.commentary: Wayne Parnell c RG Sharma b Mohammed Shami 9 (8b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 112.5

dismissalComment.html: the short one gets Parnell! Rising towards the face and he takes evasive action and yet goes ahead with the pull, miscues it and Rohit takes it easily at deep square leg

dismissalText.commentary: Vernon Philander b Mohammed Shami 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: chopped it onto his stumps, Shami bowls it short, Philander makes room to swing, inside edge lands on top of the middle stump, stumps are upright and the bails go for a toss

stories.title: India v South Africa, 2013-14
stories.subTitle: 3rd ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: India v South Africa, 2013-14; Wisden Almanack review
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the third ODI, India v South Africa, 2013-14

stories.title: India deny pulling up SuperSport
stories.subTitle: India in South Africa 2013-14
stories.summary: The Indian team management has denied a report that they had pulled up the host broadcaster during the Centurion ODI for showing a clip of Virat Kohli getting injured during the first ODI with a caption that said, "Kohli - softened up"

image.caption: Virat Kohli is hit by a short ball
image.longCaption: Virat Kohli is hit by a short ball, India v South Africa, Champions Trophy, Group B, Cardiff, June 6, 2013

stories.title: Runs and records for de Kock
stories.subTitle: India in South Africa 2013-14
stories.seoTitle: Runs and records for Quinton de Kock
stories.summary: The three-match ODI series was a special one for Quinton de Kock, who became only the fifth batsman to score three successive ODI centuries

image.caption: Quinton de Kock drives towards cover
image.longCaption: Quinton de Kock drives towards cover, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion, December 11, 2013

stories.title: De Kock laughs off Ishant's 'lucky' remark
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: De Kock laughs off Ishant's 'lucky' remark
stories.summary: There were a few sniggers in the pressroom when Ishant Sharma said Quinton de Kock, who scored three consecutive hundreds against India, had "been quite lucky"

image.caption: AB de Villiers congratulates Quinton de Kock on getting to a century
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers congratulates Quinton de Kock on getting to a century, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion, December 11, 2013

stories.title: Gibbs sees a bit of himself in fearless de Kock
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: Herschelle Gibbs sees a bit of himself in fearless Quinton de Kock
stories.summary: On a day when Quinton de Kock joined elite company with a third successive century, one of those who had managed the feat before him, Herschelle Gibbs, applauded the young batsman for his carefree method of play

image.caption: Quinton de Kock drives towards cover
image.longCaption: Quinton de Kock drives towards cover, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion, December 11, 2013

stories.title: Amla's ordinary running, and Rahane's concerns
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: Hashim Amla's running woes, and Ajinkya Rahane's concerns
stories.summary: Plays of the day from the third ODI between South Africa and India in Centurion

image.caption: David Miller scored a half-century
image.longCaption: David Miller scored a half-century, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion, December 11, 2013

stories.title: A tent against the torrent
stories.subTitle: India in South Africa 2013-14
stories.summary: With a state-of-the-art drainage system, a 12-foot-high tent protecting the pitch and groundsmen working hard day and night, Supersport Park in Centurion has all the resources at its disposal to negotiate a rain threat

image.caption: A tent protects the pitch from the rain
image.longCaption: A tent protects the pitch from the rain, South Africa v India, 1st Test, Centurion, 1st day, December 16, 2010

stories.title: Rainy end in Centurion after another de Kock ton
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: Rainy end in Centurion after another Quinton de Kock ton
stories.summary: AB de Villiers and Quinton de Kock scored centuries to rescue South Africa from 28 for 3, before India were spared another big chase by persistent rain
stories.byline: The Report by Sidharth Monga at SuperSport Park

image.caption: Quinton de Kock raises his bat after scoring his third consecutive hundred
image.longCaption: Quinton de Kock raises his bat after scoring his third consecutive hundred, South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion, December 11, 2013

stories.title: The Citi Golf carves its niche
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: The Citi Golf carves its niche
stories.summary: Ryan McLaren has made a space for himself as an allrounder in South Africa's 50-over team, distinct from the role Jacques Kallis plays

image.caption: Ryan McLaren celebrates dismissing Umar Amin
image.longCaption: Ryan McLaren celebrates dismissing Umar Amin, South Africa v Pakistan, 3rd ODI, Centurion, November 30, 2013

stories.title: India must show they can compete
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: India must show they can compete
stories.summary: Even if India do not win in Centurion, they have to prove to themselves - even more than the opposition - that they are up for a fight

image.caption: Rohit Sharma struggled to get bat on ball a few times
image.longCaption: Rohit Sharma struggled to get bat on ball a few times, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Johannesburg, December 5, 2013

stories.title: India's last chance to turn up before Test challenge
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
stories.seoTitle: India's last chance to turn up before Test challenge
stories.summary: While South Africa will want to win what is likely to be their last ODI for months, India will hope to finally gain a semblance of confidence in alien conditions ahead of the Tests

image.caption: Ravindra Jadeja was bowled by Jacques Kallis for 29
image.longCaption: Ravindra Jadeja was bowled by Jacques Kallis for 29, South Africa v India, 1st ODI, Johannesburg, December 5, 2013

videos.title: De Kock responds to Ishant's 'lucky' remark
videos.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
videos.seoTitle: De Kock responds to Ishant's 'lucky' remark
videos.summary: India pacer Ishant Sharma called Quinton de Kock 'lucky' for having reached his third consecutive ODI century against India. Here's the South Africa keeper's response.

videos.title: 'I did get a bit lucky' - de Kock
videos.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
videos.seoTitle: 'I did get a bit lucky' - Quinton de Kock
videos.summary: South Africa opener and wicketkeeper Quinton de Kock talks to the media after scoring his third successive ODI century against India in Centurion

videos.title: 'De Kock has been quite lucky' - Ishant
videos.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
videos.seoTitle: 'Quinton de Kock has been quite lucky' - Ishant Sharma
videos.summary: India bowler Ishant Sharma speaks after a rained-out third ODI against hosts South Africa who won the series 2-0

videos.title: 'Happy with our hunger' - de Villiers
videos.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
videos.seoTitle: 'Happy with our hunger' - AB de Villiers
videos.summary: South Africa captain AB de Villiers speaks after the third and final ODI of the series against India which the hosts won 2-0

videos.title: 'Lack of match practice can't be an excuse' - Rohit
videos.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
videos.seoTitle: 'Lack of match practice can't be an excuse' - Rohit
videos.summary: India opening batsman Rohit Sharma addresses the media on the eve of the third and final ODI against South Africa in Cape Town

videos.title: 'Taking wickets upfront has been our key' - McLaren
videos.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Centurion
videos.seoTitle: 'Taking wickets upfront has been our key' - Ryan McLaren
videos.summary: South Africa's Ryan McLaren speaks ahead of his side's third ODI against the visiting Indian team
